post_content:
EE launches Set Up Safe service for parents to protect children online
EE’s Set Up Safe service, developed alongside Internet Matters, provides parents a free step by step guide to set up their child’s device quickly and easily
July 28, 2020
https://www.neowin.net/news/ee-launches-set-up-safe-service-for-parents-to-protect-children-online
British telecommunications company EE has introduced a new service called Set Up Safe designed to help parents protect their children online. The new initiative is developed in collaboration with Internet Matter, a non-profit organization. The service works through SMS and guides parents through the process of setting up protective measures on children's phones.
Protect children when they use their mobile with ‘Set Up Safe’:
Our new simple-to-use service gives parents control over content locking, call blocking and online safety profiles.
Just text ‘Set Up Safe’ to 150 on the child’s phone and follow the steps to get started. pic.twitter.com/LY6ya3Ih1f
— EE (@EE) July 28, 2020​
The British operator also reported that many parents did not put any safety measures in place simply because they did not know how to do so.
Click to expand...
The new Set Up Safe SMS service from EE solves this problem for parents by offering a step-by-step guide to install protective measures on their children's devices. All monthly users are eligible to access the free service.
Those who are interested in learning more about the free Set Up Safe service can read more about it on EE's website, where an extensive guide to using the service and a comprehensive list of its features can be found.
Click to expand...
